entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY... WHAT...Surf heights of 8 to 10 feet WHERE...South and east shores of all islands WHEN...Through Friday IMPACTS...Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebreak, and strong longshore and rip currents making water recreation difficult and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 11:46AM MST until September 12 at 2:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHERN COCONINO COUNTY NEAR THE VERMILION CLIFFS... At 1142 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain from thunderstorms across the warned area has decreased in intensity. However, flash flooding is still expected as rain water drains. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 12 at 12:05PM PDT until September 15 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Strong rip currents and elevated surf expected. Surf will be 4-6 ft, with sets to 7 ft. Highest surf will be in northern Orange County. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 12 at 10:38AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT DUE TO ELEVATED PARTICULATE MATTER LEVELS FROM WINDBLOWN DUST... The Imperial County APCD has issued an air quality alert due to increased particulate matter from blowing dust. The air quality alert is in effect now until 12 AM on Wednesday, September 13, 2023. In areas directly impacted by high levels of windblown dust, limit
entry.cap:areaDesc: Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West; Imperial Valley
